conclusion: Identify numerical values at state A: P₁ = 4 atm, V₁ = 10 L
Identify numerical values at state B: P₂ = 4 atm, V₂ = 20 L
Identify numerical values at state C: P₃ = 2 atm, V₃ = 40 L
Identify numerical values at state D: P₄ = 2 atm, V₄ = 20 L
Use the ideal-gas law PV = nRT and the ratio T ∝ PV
Compute nR from state A using T₁ = 300 K: nR = P₁V₁ / T₁
Apply the ideal-gas law at state D to find T₄: T₄ = (P₄V₄)/(nR) = (P₄V₄)(T₁)/(P₁V₁)
Insert numerical values to calculate T₄: T₄ = (2 atm × 20 L) × 300 K / (4 atm × 10 L) = 300 K
Determine the temperature of the gas in state D is 300 K
